website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for an automatic battery-powered card shuffler for just 1 or 2 decks, this is the one to buy.
pros: Allows for shuffling of up to 2 decks at once, making it a good pick for average card players
Works well with cards that are standard-size
cons: Cards occasionally jam in the unit
Doesn't come with the C batteries it requires to operate
Doesn't work very well with small or large cards

customer_reviews.title: Good card shuffler for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good card shuffler, the first one came and didn't work, returned it through amazon and received a new fairly quickly. the second one worked fine. It's very hard to buy a card shuffler looking at the reviews, allot of people complain about them being cheaply made. They cost $20 bucks what do you expect, if you want a professional card shuffler they cost around $600 dollars. Bottom line for $20 bucks this thing works great.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love Card Sufflers
customer_reviews.text: This is an average card shuffler. Works most of the time but also jams up once in a while. I wasn't expecting miracles so I'm very satisfied with this purchase and would purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Pat A. Cromes

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it a couple times but so far so good. My sister has the same one and she’s been using in for a year. If you put too many cards on each side it will jam up so take it easy with the stacks of cards and you’ll be good.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I just tried it and it works fine. You can tell it is Chinese because of the quality of the materials. But at the moment it does not give problems. You need 2 size C batteries (not included). It works best with few cards on each side. I tried it with 50 cards on each side and sometimes it got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso R. C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: Its a life saver if you play alot of card based games. Iv had it for a few weeks now. Ours i feel is starting to wear out one side doesnt move as fast as the other. Idk if it is a defect or wear n tear we do use it every night after dinner and use it for several different game cards and run probably 20,000 cards or more per night through it. Works great for skipbo cards Phase 10 Sorry cards are thinner and kinda work Racko cards are thicker and can be difficult i usually just shuffle then by hand Uno cards work good
customer_reviews.author: Joe Whetstone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love love love when I play skipbo so much it’s hard to shuffle all that much
customer_reviews.author: Brandie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this...
customer_reviews.text: When this worked, it worked great. There were theee issues that made us return this and buy another (different unit) - 1) we had to apply a little pressure to the cards or they wouldn’t catch all the way and it stopped shuffling 2) It looks like the connections weren’t making proper contact having us take it apart and put it back together after every shuffle 3) the batteries didn’t fit in securely and would also continually lose contact All in all, cheaply, poorly made unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H.

customer_reviews.title: I was originally worried about ratings but no more...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and I have seen for myself how well it has worked and continues to work Months Later. Worth every penny and so far so good. If you happen to have the cards strick, lift them up and press down on the tray, the cards will push through then return the rest of the stack to the side tray. This also saves the cards from bending during a conventional shuffle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Krejci

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in first 15 minutes

customer_reviews.author: Rulouie2

customer_reviews.title: Great shuffler for the price. I had same one many years ago. Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: No card shuffler is perfect so that being said, this is a great shuffler for the money. All shufflers stick or jam every once in a while as I have had several and this is the best one so far. Simple to use and quick. Saves time manually shuffling and more accurate a shuffle than hand shuffling.

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Play rummy with a friend and we only use one card deck. Gets jammed once in a while but not often.

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars
